p: Additionally, a limited number of steroids have been isolated from Echium to date. Stigmast-4-ene-3,6-dione and β-sitosterol were identified in E. vulgare. β-sitosterol is reported to have a significant antioxidant capacity [ 97, 98]. It is likely more steroids of this type will be identified in other species with time, as phytochemicals appear to be highly conserved within this genus.
